tn.ref: Bel bows down, Nebo stoops; their idols ... for weary animals
tn.text: Isaiah speaks of people placing the idols of Bel and Nebo into a cart for animals to transport as if these gods were made to "bow down" and "stoop." These are both postures of humiliation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Bel ... Nebo
tn.text: These were the two primary gods whom the Babylonians worshiped. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: their idols
tn.text: the idols that represented Bel and Nebo

tn.ref: they cannot rescue the images
tn.text: "Bel and Nebo cannot rescue their images"

tn.ref: they themselves have gone off into captivity
tn.text: Isaiah speaks of people carrying off these idols as if the false gods whom they represent are being carried off to captivity. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Listen to me
tn.text: Here "me" refers to Yahweh.

tn.ref: who have been carried by me from before your birth, carried from the womb
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of the nation of Israel as if it were a person, and of the nation's beginning as if it were its birth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor|Metaphor]])

tn.ref: who have been carried by me
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of helping and rescuing the people of Israel as if he were carrying them. This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom I have carried" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor|Metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive|Active or Passive]])

tn.ref: Even to your old age I am he, and until your hair is gray I will carry you
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of the nation of Israel becoming very old as if it were an old man with gray hair. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor|Metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: To whom will you compare me? Who do you think I resemble, so that we may be compared?
tn.text: Yahweh uses questions to emphasize that there is no one like him. AT: "There is no one to whom you can compare me. I resemble no one, so that we might be compared." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion|Rhetorical Question]])

tn.ref: so that we may be compared
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that you may compare us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive|Active or Passive]])

tn.ref: They lift it
tn.text: "They" refers to the people who make idols and "it" refers to the idol that they have created.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to his people.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to his people.

tn.ref: I announce the end from the beginning, and beforehand what has not yet happened
tn.text: This basically repeats the same idea for emphasis. The verb from the first phrase may be supplied for the second. AT: "I announce the end from the beginning, and I announce beforehand what has not yet happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: I call a bird of prey from the east
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of Cyrus as if he were "a bird of prey." As a bird swiftly captures its prey, so Cyrus will swiftly accomplish Yahweh's purpose to conquer the nations. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: I have spoken; I will also accomplish it; I have purposed, I will also do it.
tn.text: This repeats the same idea for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: who are far from doing what is right
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of the people stubbornly doing wrong as if they were physically far away from doing the right thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: my salvation does not wait
tn.text: Yahweh speaks of saving his people soon as if his salvation were a person who does not wait to act. AT: "I will not wait to save you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
